findings.title: Negative Withdrawal Amount Increments Balance
findings.description: The application allows users to make negative transfers and increase the amount of cryptocurrency available to them for exchange operations.

findings.title: Lack of Cross-Site Request Forgery Protections
findings.description: The application lacks authenticity checks on user requests, allowing an attacker to trick users into issuing undesired requests to the server.

findings.title: Reflected Cross-site Scripting
findings.description: Reflected cross-site scripting vulnerabilities arise when data is copied from a request and echoed into the application's immediate response in an unsafe way.

findings.title: Directory Browsing Enabled
findings.description: Attackers may browse directory contents and extract data from files which were meant to be hidden, or learn about internal application behavior.

findings.title: Insecure Cookie Handling
findings.description: Cookies without the “Secure” attribute may be sent to the site during an unencrypted session, which could allow an attacker sniffing the application’s traffic to obtain sensitive information such as the session cookie and put the application at risk of a session hijacking attack.

findings.title: No OOB/2FA Confirmation Required to Perform Withdrawals
findings.description: The user is not asked for any additional confirmation, nor is the user re-authenticated to prove that the transfer request comes from the legitimate user, prior to performing a withdrawal and transferring funds from one wallet to another.

findings.title: TLS 1.0 is Insecure
findings.description: The web application server supports version 1.0 of the TLS protocol which suffers from multiple well-known cryptographic flaws, allowing attackers to exploit vulnerabilities and conduct man-in-the-middle attacks.

findings.title: Weak Password Policy
findings.description: The password policy accepts weak passwords of 6 characters containing only numerical characters, making it vulnerable to brute force attacks.

findings.title: Change Password Does Not Terminate Sessions
findings.description: Upon changing the password a user should be prompted to terminate all other existing sessions.

findings.title: No Subresource Integrity for Third-party Code
findings.description: Loading content from third parties’ remote sites poses a risk as it implies trusting the delivered content. An attacker may target those sites to inject malicious content. The Subresource Integrity feature can mitigate this risk by ensuring files are delivered without modification.
